channel.title: Metals Industry News Feed
channel.description: Automated news feed for aluminum, steel, copper, and nickel industries

item.title: China's Grip on Copper Sets Scene for Make-or-Break Supply Talks
item.description: The global copper-processing industry is facing a critical stress test as negotiations intensify amid China's dominance in securing copper concentrate supply and driving down processing fees. Chinese smelters continue to expand, crowding out international competitors and prompting concerns about the viability of the benchmark pricing system.

item.title: China's Grip on Copper Sets Scene for Make-or-Break Supply Talks
item.description: Geopolitical tensions and China's growing control over copper concentrate supply are putting pressure on the global benchmark pricing mechanism. The expansion of Chinese smelting capacity has led to plummeting processing fees and increased struggles for smelters outside China.

item.title: Copper Processing Industry Faces Pricing Stress Test
item.description: The global copper processing industry is experiencing a major stress test due to China's dominance, constrained metal supplies, and the rapid expansion of processing capacity outpacing mined production. This is raising questions about the sustainability of the current benchmarking structure.

item.title: Australian Mining Giant BHP Drops Anglo American Takeover Bid
item.description: BHP, a major Australian mining company, has withdrawn its takeover bid for Anglo American, which could impact future copper production and capacity expansion plans in the sector.

item.title: China's Grip on Copper Sets Scene for Make-or-Break Supply Talks
item.description: China's dominant position in copper supply is influencing critical supply talks, with the country deploying digital tools to drive efficiency in copper production. This dynamic is shaping the global copper market amid rising demand and supply challenges.

item.title: Nickel Prices Enter Downward Channel as Weakening Costs Keep Stainless Steel Under Pressure
item.description: Nickel prices have entered a downward channel due to weakening costs and increased production capacity in China and Indonesia. The oversupply and weak demand are keeping stainless steel prices under pressure, with little room for a near-term rebound in nickel prices.

item.title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
item.description: Nickel prices have dropped to 14,532.00 USD/ton, the lowest since April 2025, losing 4.57% over the past four weeks and 8.05% over the past year. The market remains bearish due to persistent oversupply and weak demand.

item.title: FLASH: Indonesia releases benchmark prices for nickel ore in November period I
item.description: Indonesia's Nickel Miners Association (APNI) set the benchmark price for nickel ore at $15,075.33/wmt for the first half of November 2025, a slight decrease from October. Prices for various grades of nickel ore also declined marginally.

item.title: On November 24, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
item.description: The SMM #1 refined nickel price was reported at 115,400–120,100 yuan/mt on November 24, with an average price of 117,750 yuan/mt, up 1,050 yuan/mt from the previous day. The market saw a slight rebound amid ongoing oversupply concerns.

item.title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Rebound Slightly on November 24 as US-Ukraine Talks Make Significant Progress
item.description: Nickel prices rebounded slightly on November 24, with the SMM #1 refined nickel price averaging 117,750 yuan/mt, up 1,050 yuan/mt from the previous day. The rebound was attributed to progress in US-Ukraine talks, but oversupply remains a concern.

item.title: MMG's deal to buy Anglo American's Brazil nickel assets faces EU regulatory delay
item.description: MMG's acquisition of Anglo American's Brazilian nickel assets is facing delays due to regulatory scrutiny from the European Commission, which is concerned the deal could divert ferronickel supplies away from Europe and negatively impact the European stainless steel industry.

item.title: FLASH: Indonesia releases benchmark prices for nickel ore in November (Period I)
item.description: The Indonesia Nickel Miners Association (APNI) has announced the benchmark prices for nickel ore for the first half of November 2025, providing updated guidance for the domestic market amid ongoing supply and pricing volatility.

item.title: SMM Nickel Ore Port Inventory
item.description: On November 24, 2025, the national port nickel ore inventory in China increased by 97,000 wet tons, reaching a total of 10.106 million wet tons, reflecting continued high supply levels and inventory buildup.

item.title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
item.description: Nickel prices fell to $14,549.75 per tonne on November 24, 2025, down 0.48% from the previous day, continuing a downward trend as global supply outpaces demand and inventories remain elevated.

item.title: Aluminum rose to 2,814.85 USD/T on November 24, 2025
item.description: Aluminum prices increased to 2,814.85 USD per ton on November 24, 2025, up 0.33% from the previous day. Despite a 2.13% drop over the past month, prices remain 5.87% higher than a year ago, reflecting ongoing volatility in the market.

item.title: Aluminum Caps and Closures Market Size, Trends and Regional Data 2025-2035
item.description: The global aluminum caps and closures market reached USD 9.79 billion in 2025 and is projected to grow to USD 14.60 billion by 2034. The growth is driven by rising demand for product safety, government initiatives like Make in India, and increased focus on sustainable packaging and recycling.

item.title: Aluminum Caps and Closures Market Size, Trends and Regional Data 2025-2035
item.description: The global aluminum caps and closures market was valued at USD 9.79 billion in 2025 with projections through 2035. This market report provides regional data and trend analysis for the aluminum closures industry.

item.title: Copper Stabilizes on Dovish Fed Bets
item.description: Copper prices steadied around $5 per pound, supported by dovish comments from a senior US Federal Reserve official and expectations for a rate cut. Supply concerns were highlighted by Codelco's record premium and Freeport McMoRan's production update.

item.title: Copper Alloys Market Trends, Shares, Strategies and Investment Prospects 2025-2030
item.description: The article discusses the latest developments in copper alloy technology, including product and process innovations and emerging technologies shaping the competitive landscape. It highlights how innovation and technology trends are driving growth and sustainability in the copper alloys market.

item.title: Nickel price hits 4-year low as gloom offsets potential Indonesia cuts
item.description: Nickel prices fell to a four-year low of $15,235 per ton on the London Metal Exchange, pressured by a weaker outlook from the Federal Reserve despite potential mining quota cuts in Indonesia. Indonesia is considering reducing its nickel ore mining quota sharply from 272 million tons in 2025 to 150 million tons in 2026 to support prices. The metal's decline is also linked to new supply expectations and a slowdown in electric vehicle sales.

item.title: Value of EV battery nickel second highest on record, cobalt at 30-month high
item.description: Spending on nickel for electric vehicle batteries reached the second highest level on record in the three months ending October 2025, totaling $1.71 billion. Despite recent price slumps, nickel sulphate prices remain elevated, supporting demand in the EV supply chain. Cobalt spending also surged, driven by shifts in battery chemistry and government stockpiling plans.

item.title: China's grip on copper sets scene for make-or-break supply talks
item.description: China's dominance in copper processing is creating tensions as global supply negotiations approach a critical point. The industry faces challenges due to geopolitical tensions, limited metal availability, and pressure on the pricing mechanism that underpins global copper trade.

item.title: Expectations for US Fed Interest Rate Cuts Rise Again, Aluminum Prices Hover at Highs
item.description: LME aluminum prices opened at $2,802.5/mt and reached an intraday high of $2,817.5/mt on November 25, 2025, closing at $2,813/mt. The market remains in a consolidation phase, with primary aluminum prices showing a narrow-range adjustment trend and downstream demand diverging by alloy type.

item.title: Aluminum Sheet and Plate Market Report: By Key Players, Types
item.description: The latest report on the Global Aluminum Sheet and Plate Market was released on November 25, 2025, covering manufacturers, regions, types and applications. This market analysis provides insights into current trends and key players in the aluminum sheet and plate sector.

item.title: Stocks of Main Finished Steel Products in China Down 2.5 Percent in Mid-Nov 2025
item.description: Stocks of main finished steel products in China declined by 2.5 percent in mid-November 2025, indicating tighter supply conditions and potential upward pressure on prices.

item.title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
item.description: Steel prices rose to 3,108 CNY/T on November 25, 2025, up 0.55% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have increased slightly but remain lower than a year ago.

item.title: EU appeals WTO ruling in Indonesia steel standoff
item.description: The European Union has appealed a World Trade Organization ruling that found errors in its tariff settings on Indonesian stainless steel imports. This move continues the trade dispute between the EU and Indonesia over steel tariffs, impacting international steel trade relations.

item.title: Codelco to Partner with India's Adani Group, LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Higher Overnight
item.description: LME copper prices fluctuated overnight, closing at $10,781.5/mt, up 0.03%. Supply-side arrivals decreased, while state-owned supply replenished normally. Demand weakened after the rebound, and Chinese inventories dropped by 13,900 mt WoW.

item.title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
item.description: Copper rose to 5.04 USD/lb on November 25, up 1.04% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have fallen 1.88%, but remain 24.33% higher than a year ago. The all-time high was reached in July 2025.

item.title: Copper slips, US rate cut hopes support sentiment
item.description: Benchmark copper on the LME was down 0.3% at $10,749/mt, but sentiment was supported by hopes for a US rate cut. The price had previously hit a record high of $11,200/mt.

item.title: UBS Forecasts Continued Copper Price Surge
item.description: UBS has raised its copper price forecasts for 2026, citing tightening supply due to mine disruptions and strong demand from electrification and clean-energy investments. The bank now expects a market deficit of 230,000 tonnes in 2025 and 407,000 tonnes in 2026, with prices projected to reach $13,000 per tonne by December 2026.

item.title: Chinese Copper Smelters to Face Record Low Fees for 2026
item.description: Chinese copper smelters are expected to accept record low processing fees for 2026 due to ongoing global ore shortages and intense competition for raw materials. This reflects the continued strain on supply chains and the challenges facing new and existing smelting operations.

item.title: Arizona Copper and Gold Ltd. and Core Nickel Corp. Provide Update on Reverse Takeover Transaction and Concurrent Financing
item.description: Arizona Copper and Gold Ltd. and Core Nickel Corp. announced updates on their reverse takeover transaction and concurrent financing, with the closing scheduled for November 25, 2025. The companies expect to issue an aggregate of shares as part of the transaction.

item.title: Copper RRS 2025 — BHP's reserves base provides 27 years of future output
item.description: BHP's copper reserves are projected to support 27 years of future output, with innovations expected to produce 410,000 metric tons of copper cathodes over a decade. The article emphasizes the role of technological innovation in sustaining long-term copper supply for the energy transition.

item.title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Continue to Rebound on November 25
item.description: Nickel prices rebounded on November 25 with the SMM #1 refined nickel price averaging 118,550 yuan/mt, up 800 yuan/mt from the previous day. The rebound was supported by dovish signals from the US Federal Reserve, which increased market expectations for an interest rate cut in December from 40% to 75%. Despite short-term fluctuations, long-term pressure on nickel prices remains, with the SHFE nickel contract projected to trade between 114,000-118,000 yuan/mt.

item.title: Major Indonesia Nickel Plant Cuts Output as Waste Piles Up
item.description: A major Chinese-owned nickel plant at Indonesia’s Morawali Industrial Park is reducing production due to its tailings storage nearing capacity, highlighting ongoing waste management challenges in the rapidly expanding nickel sector. The reduction is expected to last at least two weeks while new storage solutions are processed.

item.title: Major Indonesia Nickel Plant Cuts Output as Waste Piles Up
item.description: Indonesia’s largest nickel site, Morawali Industrial Park, is experiencing reduced output at a key plant due to full tailings storage, with paperwork for new storage still pending. The situation underscores the environmental and logistical pressures facing Indonesia’s dominant nickel industry.

item.title: Canada Nickel Announces Bought Deal Private Placement is Oversubscribed and Fully Allocated
item.description: Canada Nickel Company has announced that its recent private placement offering was oversubscribed and fully allocated, signaling strong investor interest in the company’s nickel projects and expansion plans.

item.title: Aluminum prices are expected to hover at highs in the short term
item.description: Aluminum prices are forecasted to remain high in the short term due to ongoing supply constraints and demand factors. Inventory levels and import dynamics in China are key influences on price stability.

item.title: Aluminum prices are expected to hover at highs in the short term
item.description: According to SMM statistics, aluminum prices are expected to remain high in the short term, influenced by market dynamics including supply constraints and demand factors.

item.title: Steel Market News: Spain Increases Steel Production by 11.6% in October
item.description: Spain's steel production rose by 11.6% month-over-month in October 2025. Other notable market developments include the US reducing imports of rolled steel by 7.6% in June and Acerinox considering price increases in the US market.

item.title: Steel Price Rises to 3,097 CNY/T on November 25, 2025
item.description: Steel prices in China rose slightly by 0.19% to 3,097 CNY/T on November 25, 2025. Over the past month, steel prices increased by 0.32%, although they remain 5.78% lower compared to the previous year.

item.title: Carney expected to announce support measures for steel industry hit by U.S. tariffs
item.description: The Canadian federal government plans to limit foreign steel imports and reduce interprovincial rail freight rates to support the domestic steel industry affected by U.S. tariffs. Prime Minister Mark Carney is expected to announce new funding and tighter import limits to help Canadian steel producers fill domestic demand gaps.

item.title: Carney expected to announce new supports for steel industry hammered by U.S. tariffs
item.description: The Canadian government aims to cut steel imports from countries without free trade agreements from 50% to 20% of 2024 levels, opening an estimated $854 million in domestic demand. Additionally, freight rates for interprovincial steel shipments may be cut by 50%, with subsidies if rail companies cannot comply, to support the steel sector amid U.S. tariff pressures.

item.title: Boston Metal Names Industry Veteran Roy Harvey to Board of Directors
item.description: Boston Metal, a company innovating in global metals production, announced the appointment of Roy Harvey, an industry veteran, to its board of directors. This move underscores the company's commitment to advancing steel technology innovation and sustainable metals production.

item.title: Comex Copper Settles 0.76% Higher at $4.9995 — Data Talk
item.description: Front Month Comex Copper for November delivery rose 0.76% to $4.9995 per pound, marking gains in two of the past three sessions. Despite being down 13.73% from its 52-week high in July, copper is up 25.43% year-to-date, reflecting strong market performance overall.

item.title: Copper rises as outflows to US stocks provide support - Markets
item.description: Benchmark copper on the London Metal Exchange rose 0.8% to $10,855 per metric ton, supported by outflows to US stocks. The market showed positive momentum amid ongoing supply concerns and steady demand.

item.title: Codelco offers record premiums for 2026 copper sales to China
item.description: Chile's state-owned Codelco proposed record premiums of $335 per ton for copper sales to some buyers, reflecting tightening supply conditions in the global copper market ahead of 2026 negotiations.

item.title: Codelco's Record Premiums Signal a New Era for Copper Demand and Strategic Investment Opportunities
item.description: Codelco, the world's largest copper producer, faces a 25% output decline due to mine collapse and aging infrastructure, amid surging demand driven by electric vehicles and AI data centers. Record premiums and prices reflect a structural market shift, with forecasts of significant annual deficits through 2026, prompting major investments in mine modernization and safety.

item.title: Battery X Metals Announces New Strategic Partnership with Global Top 20 University
item.description: Battery X Metals has partnered with a leading university to develop an eco-friendly froth-flotation process for recovering critical battery materials including nickel from end-of-life lithium-ion batteries. This innovation aims to create a circular, resource-efficient supply chain that reduces environmental impact and supports North America's clean energy ecosystem.

item.title: Indonesian coastal villages in the dark over nickel pollution
item.description: Environmental violations at Indonesia's Morowali Industrial Park highlight ongoing nickel pollution issues affecting local coastal communities. Experts call for stricter sustainability standards to ensure responsible mining practices, warning that failure to improve could reduce global demand for Indonesian nickel.

item.title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches pilot phase of green hydrogen project
item.description: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started the pilot phase of producing green hydrogen at its plant in Aosta, Italy. The project aims to reduce carbon emissions by using a 1.008 MW Anion Exchange Membrane electrolyzer to produce 165 tons of hydrogen annually, enough to power one of its 70 furnaces and prevent up to 26 tons of carbon emissions per ton of hydrogen. This initiative is supported by €7.9 million funding from Italy’s National Recovery and Resilience Plan.

item.title: Cogne Acciai Speciali SpA Announces Its Commitment to Sustainability with ResponsibleSteel™ Certification
item.description: Cogne Acciai Speciali has embarked on the path to obtain ResponsibleSteel™ certification, formalizing its commitment to sustainability, environmental protection, and transparency. The company emphasizes that sustainability is integral to its daily operations and aims to create lasting value for employees, customers, and local communities through responsible steel production.

item.title: Cogne Acciai Speciali finalises a 200 million euro share capital increase and the acquisition of Special Melted Products in UK
item.description: Cogne Acciai Speciali completed a €200 million share capital increase and acquired Special Melted Products in the UK, expanding its portfolio and strengthening its position in the stainless steel and nickel alloy markets. This strategic move supports the company’s growth and vertical integration plans.

item.title: Italian expertise fuels Prysmian innovation
item.description: Prysmian's innovation strategy is strongly driven by its Milan R&D center, with significant investments in Italy totaling €216 million between 2021 and 2024 and plans for an additional €270 million by 2028. The company focuses on high-voltage terrestrial and submarine transmission systems and renewable energy integration, supported by Italian government funding and strategic partnerships.

item.title: BofA Sees Growth Potential for Prysmian from US Tariffs
item.description: Bank of America projects Prysmian could benefit significantly from US copper tariffs, potentially increasing copper cable prices by 10% and boosting 2026 EBITDA by up to EUR1 billion. This advantage stems from Prysmian's US-based copper cable production after acquiring Encore Wire, with the greatest benefits expected in medium- and low-voltage segments.

item.title: Prysmian Raises Annual Targets After Record Q3 Performance
item.description: Prysmian has raised its full-year 2025 financial guidance following a record third quarter, reflecting strong revenue growth and operational performance. The company continues to capitalize on its global footprint and innovation in cable technologies, reinforcing its market leadership.

item.title: BWR Exploration Inc. and Electro Metals and Mining Inc. Announce Meeting of Shareholders and Record Date
item.description: BWR Exploration and Electro Metals and Mining announced a transaction to create a new publicly traded company focused on high-grade copper and gold projects in Canada, aiming to advance exploration and development with significant growth potential.

item.title: The future of EU steel research – How to foster EU steel leadership
item.description: An upcoming event will focus on groundbreaking steel technologies, sustainability strategies, and challenges facing the EU steel industry. Topics include low to zero emission steel production and circularity, aiming to disseminate steel R&D projects and foster EU leadership in sustainable steel innovation.

item.title: HRC Steel Price Falls Slightly on November 26, 2025
item.description: Hot-Rolled Coil (HRC) Steel price fell to 898.05 USD/T on November 26, 2025, down 0.44% from the previous day. Despite the recent dip, HRC Steel prices have risen 4.91% over the past month and are up 28.32% compared to the same time last year.

item.title: Steel Prices and Market Data for Energy Traders and Analysts
item.description: S&P Global provides comprehensive and real-time steel market prices, data, and analysis, helping market participants monitor price fluctuations and trends. Their resources include historical and spot prices, forward curves, and detailed market insights to support decision-making in the steel commodity market.

item.title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News Update - November 26, 2025
item.description: SteelRadar provides up-to-date prices, news, and analyses for the global iron and steel industry, including futures prices for Turkey, India, Taiwan, China, Europe, and North America as of November 24, 2025. The platform offers comprehensive market transparency and insights.

item.title: The Future of EU Steel Research - How to foster EU steel leadership
item.description: This event in Mönchengladbach, Germany, focuses on advancing innovation and sustainability in Europe's steel industry. It highlights the Research Fund for Coal and Steel's role in driving decarbonization, competitiveness, and industrial transformation through breakthroughs in low to zero-emission steelmaking, energy efficiency, and circular economy solutions.

item.title: Steel Meets Innovation: Emerging Technologies Reshaping the Sector
item.description: This article discusses how advances in AI and green steel technologies are transforming the steel industry. It highlights the adoption of smart manufacturing and sustainable production methods to meet growing demand while reducing environmental impact.

item.title: Harmony Copper Mine Project Investment Approved, LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Higher Overnight
item.description: LME copper prices fluctuated overnight, closing up 0.47% at $10,832.5/mt amid tight supply of high-quality copper and easing geopolitical risks such as potential Russia-Ukraine peace talks. US retail sales data falling short of expectations strengthened market hopes for a Fed interest rate cut, supporting copper prices despite some easing in downstream demand.

item.title: Copper rose to 5.03 USD/Lbs on November 26, 2025
item.description: Copper futures climbed above $5 per pound, reaching a near two-week high as investors positioned ahead of a key industry gathering in Shanghai. The global copper-processing sector has faced record low annual treatment and refining charges as metal-processing capacity in China outpaced mined production. Prices were supported by signs of tightening supply, with Chile's Codelco proposing record premiums for 2026 metal sales.

item.title: Barrick committed to Pakistan's Reko Diq copper project, says interim CEO
item.description: Barrick Mining Corp reaffirmed its commitment to the Reko Diq copper mine in Pakistan, one of the world's largest undeveloped deposits. The $7 billion project is expected to produce up to 400,000 tons of copper yearly and is scheduled to start production by the end of 2028.

item.title: Doubleview Gold Corp. Achieves a Major Breakthrough in Scandium Recovery from Copper Porphyry Tailings
item.description: Doubleview Gold Corp achieved a global first in successfully recovering scandium from copper porphyry flotation tailings with 88% overall recovery to high-purity scandium oxide product. The breakthrough could enable scandium to become a high-margin bonus product alongside a potential world-class copper-gold-cobalt operation at the HAT project.

item.title: On November 26, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
item.description: On November 26, the SMM #1 refined nickel price rose further to an average of 119,850 yuan/mt, up 1,300 yuan/mt from the previous day, indicating continued short-term price recovery amid market fluctuations.

item.title: LME nickel price drops 3.7% on Nov 26
item.description: The London Metal Exchange (LME) nickel price fell by 3.7% on November 26, closing at US$19,897 per ton. This decline reflects ongoing volatility in the nickel market despite recent rebounds in some regions.

item.title: Indonesia's Nickel Supply & The Global Price Slump: What the Market Sell-Off Signals for Investors
item.description: Nickel prices have fallen to $14,550 per tonne, near a four-year low, due to Indonesia's refinery expansion flooding the market and causing oversupply. Despite Indonesia's planned quota cuts, market skepticism remains about their impact on tightening supply. LME inventories surged by 90,000 tonnes in 2025, with stainless steel demand weak but EV battery growth providing some long-term support.

item.title: Nickel Falls to 7-Month Low
item.description: Nickel futures in the UK dropped to $14,550 per tonne in November 2025, the lowest since a four-year low in April, due to mounting oversupply largely driven by Indonesia's over-expansion of its nickel sector. Prices have fallen 2.99% over the past month and 6.56% year-over-year, reflecting ample output despite export restrictions implemented since 2020.

item.title: Waste constraints hit output at major Indonesia nickel plant
item.description: A major Chinese-owned nickel processing plant in Indonesia's key production hub has reduced output due to waste management constraints. This development adds complexity to the already oversupplied nickel market dominated by Indonesia's refinery expansion.

item.title: FPX Nickel secures ECOLOGO certification for sustainable practices
item.description: FPX Nickel has achieved UL Solutions ECOLOGO certification, marking a significant milestone in sustainable mineral exploration. This certification reflects the company's commitment to transparency, accountability, and minimizing environmental impacts, making it the first Canadian company outside Quebec to earn this recognition.

item.title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
item.description: Aluminum prices rose to $2,871.65 per tonne on November 26, 2025, up 2.12% from the previous day, rebounding from a recent four-week low. Despite a slight monthly decline, prices remain nearly 10% higher than a year ago, supported by macroeconomic tailwinds and stimulus signals.

item.title: LME Aluminium Cash Offer Jumps 1.27% to $2,822.50/t as Opening Stocks Fall
item.description: LME aluminium prices rose to $2,822.50 per tonne on November 26, 2025, as exchange stocks declined by 0.37%. The increase reflects tightening supply conditions and sustained market demand.

item.title: The Premium for Aluminum in the US Spot Market Has Hit a Record High
item.description: The US spot market aluminum premium reached a record high, with buyers paying $4,792 per tonne when the base price is $2,850. The surge is attributed to import tariffs and global supply constraints.

item.title: Carney to announce new supports today for steel industry hammered by U.S. tariffs
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney announced new measures to support Canada's steel sector, including limiting foreign steel imports and cutting interprovincial rail freight rates by 50%. The government plans to reduce steel imports from non-free-trade agreement countries to 20% of 2024 levels and subsidize rail freight rate reductions to help the industry affected by U.S. tariffs.

item.title: Canada unveils more measures to protect tariff-hit steel, lumber industries
item.description: Canada announced enhanced protections for its steel and lumber industries facing U.S. tariffs, including reducing steel import quotas from non-FTA countries to 20% of 2024 levels and imposing a 25% tariff on steel derivative products. The government will also work with railways to cut freight rates by 50% for interprovincial steel shipments and support local steel use in construction.

item.title: 'Fire away copper, build the bank': Revolver Resources
item.description: Revolver Resources is preparing for a final investment decision to develop copper production, expecting first copper cathode output in H2 2026. The company highlights strong copper demand growth and increased copper grades in its resource, positioning it well for production and cash flow generation next year.

item.title: All resolutions passed as the company advances copper expansion and strategic partnerships
item.description: HCH announced the passing of all resolutions related to advancing its copper expansion projects and forming strategic partnerships, signaling progress in increasing copper production capacity.

item.title: AI boom pushes copper toward a supply crunch, BNEF warns
item.description: The expansion of artificial intelligence data centres is increasing copper demand by an estimated 400,000 tonnes annually, with prices potentially reaching $13,500 per tonne by 2028. Energy transition projects and fragile mine supply are adding additional pressure to the copper market.

item.title: SPC Nickel highlights Muskox's geological potential
item.description: SPC Nickel has released assay results from its 2025 exploration program at the Muskox Project in Nunavut, Canada, revealing high-grade copper-nickel-platinum group mineralization and significant exploration potential. The results reinforce Muskox as a leading exploration opportunity with the potential for multiple deposits.

item.title: 6K Additive Secures Approval for $27.4 Million EXIM Loan to assist with Critical Minerals Expansion in Pennsylvania
item.description: 6K Additive has secured a $27.4 million EXIM loan to expand its powder capacity in Pennsylvania, including nickel powders for additive manufacturing. The expansion will increase production capacity and support growing demand for critical minerals in defense and advanced manufacturing sectors.

item.title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
item.description: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started operations at a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, northern Italy. This initiative aligns with the company's commitment to sustainability and reducing carbon emissions in steel production.

item.title: EC approves Mannesmann Stainless Pipes' acquisition by Cogne
item.description: The European Commission has approved Cogne Acciai Speciali's acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Pipes, enabling Cogne to gain control over MST and its subsidiaries across Europe and the U.S. The deal, valued at EUR 135 million, strengthens Cogne's position in the stainless steel tube market.

item.title: According to SMM statistics, the weekly aluminum ingot outflow was 143200 tons last week
item.description: Weekly aluminum ingot outflow reached 143,200 tons, representing an increase of 18,500 tons compared to the previous week. This data reflects current market activity in aluminum production and distribution.

item.title: Canada to add new tariffs to US steel, curb foreign imports
item.description: Canada introduced a new 25% tariff on steel derivative products imported from the U.S. as part of a broader strategy to protect its steel industry. This marks the first time new import taxes on U.S. products have been added since most retaliatory tariffs were dropped in September, aiming to curb foreign imports and support domestic producers.

item.title: Govt Urged to Act on Surge in Cheap Imported Steel
item.description: The Australian steel industry has requested emergency trade relief measures to counter a surge in low-priced imported fabricated steelwork threatening local manufacturers. The Australian Steel Institute highlighted significant business closures and reduced capacity utilization due to competition from cheap imports, urging government intervention to preserve domestic steel production capacity.

item.title: Iron Ore Prices Forecast to Ease
item.description: Iron ore prices are expected to decline in 2026 due to increased supply from new projects and ongoing demand pressure from China. Despite low inventories supporting prices currently, factors such as steel production curbs and weak Chinese demand are forecasted to weigh on prices, with a long-term decline projected through 2034.

item.title: Copper breaks above $11,000 on increased likelihood of US rate cut
item.description: Copper prices rose to their highest level in almost a month, reaching $11,025 per metric ton on Wednesday. The rally was driven by increased expectations for a US Federal Reserve rate cut, with CME's FedWatch Tool showing over 84% probability of a 25 basis point cut in December.

item.title: Highland Copper Partial Project Equity Transfer Overnight LME Copper Surged Significantly
item.description: LME copper opened at $10,992.5/mt and touched a high of $11,009.5/mt in early trading on Thursday, November 27, 2025. The contract closed at $10,953/mt, up 1.11%, with trading volume at 22,000 lots.

item.title: Mercuria's copper bull forecasts more price records next year
item.description: A squeeze in global copper markets is expected to tighten again next year, pushing prices of concentrate and refined metal to new records. Market analysts forecast continued upward pressure on copper prices due to supply constraints.

item.title: Comex copper premium here to stay, LME executive says
item.description: An LME executive stated that the copper price premium on the US Comex exchange over the London Metal Exchange is likely to persist over the next 18 months. This premium reflects structural differences in the two markets.

item.title: UBS raises copper outlook as mine disruptions deepen supply deficits
item.description: UBS lowered its refined copper production growth estimates to 1.2% for 2025 and 2.2% for 2026 due to declining ore grades and operational challenges at mines, signaling deeper supply deficits in the copper market.

item.title: Mitsubishi Materials to cut primary copper smelting volume by 30% to 40% by 2035
item.description: Japan's Mitsubishi Materials announced plans to reduce its primary copper smelting volume by 30% to 40% by 2035, reflecting strategic adjustments in copper production capacity over the next decade.

item.title: LME nickel prices rise to 2-week high
item.description: Despite recent losses and a market closure, LME nickel futures rebounded, closing at $15,285 per ton, up $185 from the previous session. The recovery comes amid ongoing volatility and oversupply concerns in the nickel market.

item.title: Nickel Price Update: Q3 2025 in Review
item.description: Nickel prices remained volatile in the first half of 2025 but stabilized in Q3, with ongoing oversupply concerns continuing to weigh on the market. The article reviews recent trends and factors influencing nickel prices over the past quarter.

item.title: Unleashing sustainable nickel production for a net zero future
item.description: This article explores how optimizing nickel production, particularly through High Pressure Acid Leaching (HPAL), can create a more sustainable battery industry with a lower carbon footprint. It highlights efforts in pollution prevention, biodiversity conservation, waste management, and stakeholder engagement to advance sustainable nickel production aligned with global net-zero goals.

item.title: Genomines raises $45M to grow nickel from plants, not mines
item.description: French start-up Genomines secured $45 million in Series A funding to scale its innovative method of extracting nickel from plants instead of traditional mining. This approach promises faster, cheaper, and cleaner nickel production with higher purity and productivity, and the company is piloting projects with major automakers and battery manufacturers.
